title: Amit Shah blames Congress for Chhattisgarh lynching
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has blamed "appeasement politics" for the lynching of a young man in Chhattisgarh and urged voters to remove the Congress party from office in the upcoming assembly polls. Shah referenced the communal clashes in Biranpur village, where a man was murdered, and called on people to prevent such clashes in the future.

title: 20 yo student alleges harassment by off-duty pilot
description: A college student has accused an off-duty pilot of harassment on an Akasa Air flight from Bengaluru to Pune. The pilot allegedly forced her to switch seats and offered her an alcoholic drink. The airline claims to have investigated the matter but was unable to reach the woman. The woman says that she had communicated with the airline through social media but had not received any further contact. The incident occurred on October 1st.

title: Israeli reoccupation of Gaza to be 'big mistake', warns Biden
description: President Joe Biden has warned Israel against reoccupying Gaza, following the recent Hamas assault that resulted in the deaths of more than 1,300 people, including 29 Americans. While Biden has been a staunch supporter of Israel, he cautioned against a full-scale occupation of Gaza, stating that Hamas and its extremists do not represent all Palestinians.

title: Rajnath slams those backing Hamas, says condemn terrorism
description: During his campaign trail in Telangana, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh criticized those supporting terrorism, referring to the Israel-Hamas conflict. He also accused Telangana CM K Chandrashekhar Rao of corruption and nepotism, highlighting the state's lack of progress despite its growth potential.

title: Some people are working to harm our name, claim Adanis
description: The Adani group has accused certain individuals and groups of trying to harm its reputation and market standing. They claim that these entities have been working since 2018 to besmirch the group and its chairman Gautam Adani. A lawyer has filed a complaint with the CBI, alleging a criminal conspiracy by Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra and Hiranandani group CEO Darshan Hiranandani to target Adani and his companies through parliamentary questions.

title: After 128 years, cricket back in Olympics at LA
description: Cricket will return to the Olympics at Los Angeles 2028 after an absence of more than a century, while squash will make its debut on the Games programme. The inclusion of both sports was formalised at the 141st International Olympic Committee session here Monday.

title: JD(S) Karnataka chief signals split, says no to BJP tie-up
description: The Karnataka unit president of the Janata Dal (Secular) party, CM Ibrahim, has stated that the party will not join the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections, defying the decision of party supremo H D Deve Gowda. Ibrahim claimed that his faction is the original JD(S) and appealed to Gowda not to give consent to the alliance with the BJP.

title: Donald Trump sues ex-UK spy over dossier that claimed 'sex parties' in Russia
description: Former US President Donald Trump is suing British private investigations firm Orbis Business Intelligence in a London court over allegations made in the Steele dossier. The dossier, published in 2017, claimed ties between Trump's campaign and Russia, as well as alleged sexual behavior. Trump is seeking to prove that the claims are false and that the dossier contains numerous inaccuracies.

title: 6-year-old Palestinian boy dies after being stabbed 26 times
description: A 6-year-old boy was fatally stabbed and his mother seriously wounded in a hate crime in suburban Chicago. The attack was believed to be motivated by the victims' Muslim faith and tied to the violence in Israel and the Gaza Strip. The 71-year-old landlord targeted the family, who are Palestinian American, and stabbed them repeatedly with a serrated knife.

title: Gaza border remains shut as Israel warns of a 'long war'
description: The Gaza Strip is facing a worsening humanitarian crisis as thousands of people flee their homes amid Israeli airstrikes and shortages of essential supplies. Both Israel and Hamas have dismissed talk of a ceasefire. Israel has imposed a blockade on Gaza and launched airstrikes, with a ground assault expected. Power and water supplies are scarce, and emergency fuel is running out.

title: SC may hear NewsClick founder's plea on UAPA use
description: The Supreme Court Monday said it will consider listing for hearing the plea of NewsClick founder Prabir Purkayastha and its HR head Amit Chakravarty against the Delhi high court's rejection of their petitions challenging their arrest and police remand in a case lodged under anti-terror law UAPA.

title: HC: Why can't unmarried women go for surrogacy?
description: The Delhi High Court has questioned the Centre about the legal prohibition on single, unmarried women opting for surrogacy procedures to become parents. The court was hearing a plea from a 44-year-old unmarried woman who wanted to have a genetically related child via surrogacy due to potential medical complications.

title: After 13 death sentences, high court acquits Nithari's Koli
description: Surinder Koli, who was convicted for the Nithari killings in 2006, has been acquitted by the Allahabad high court. The court expressed disappointment with the flawed investigation into the brutalities. Koli's employer, Moninder Singh Pandher, was also acquitted. The court stated that the prosecution failed to prove their guilt beyond reasonable doubt, and criticized the violation of basic norms of collecting evidence.

title: SC verdict today on right to marry for LGBTQIA+ people
description: The Supreme Court of India is set to deliver its verdict on a batch of petitions by the LGBTQIA+ community seeking the right to marriage under the Special Marriage Act. The community argues that discrimination based on sexual orientation and gender identity violates constitutional guarantees of equality, non-discrimination, freedom of expression, privacy, and dignity.

title: Two dead in Brussels shooting, suspect on the run
Earthquake of magnitude 3.3 hits Maharashtra
Married couple killed after bike sandwiched between buses in Kerala
description: The tragedy unfolded when a private bus rear-ended the two-wheeler, leading to the unfortunate demise of the couple, as reported by the authorities.

title: Tension in Aligarh as two communities clash over changed 'shobha yatra' route
PM Modi interacts with Google CEO Sundar Pichai
China-built Pokhara airport may become Nepal's Gwadar Port
description: Nepal's Pokhara international airport, funded largely by Chinese banks, is facing economic difficulties and long-term debt. The airport, similar to Pakistan's Gwadar Port, has failed to attract investment and prosperity to the region. Despite being built outside of China's Belt and Road initiative, Chinese banks provided most of the funding and a Chinese firm constructed the airport.

title: Nuh violence: Court gives bail to Monu Manesar in hate speech case
description: Monu Manesar had moved bail on October 10, which came up for hearing in the court of Amit Verma Judicial magistrate first class.

title: Australia revive WC campaign with 5-wicket win over Lanka
description: Mitchell Marsh and Josh Inglis smashed half-centuries as Australia beat Sri Lanka by five wickets to register their first win of the 2023 World Cup on Monday. Leg-spinner Adam Zampa returned figures of 4-47 to help bowl out Sri Lanka for 209, a total the five-time winners overhauled in 35.2 overs at Lucknow's Ekana Stadium. Australia registered their first win in three matches while former champions Sri Lanka slipped to a third loss in as many games.

title: 33 Polyhymnia: An asteroid that defies nature
description: Scientists are showing renewed interest in studying space objects that may contain never-before-seen heavy elements, such as the asteroid 33 Polyhymnia. The asteroid appears to be denser than any known elements on the periodic table, potentially indicating the presence of an element with an atomic number higher than 118. While elements with more than 118 protons have not been observed, theoretical work suggests the possibility of an "island of nuclear stability" around atomic number 164.

title: How TCS, Infosys, HCL Tech Q2 results show record billion dollar deals aren't enough
description: The Q2 earnings for major IT services companies Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys, and HCL Tech have shown positive results in terms of margins and deal wins. TCS reported an EBIT margin of 24.3%, Infosys 21.2%, and HCL Tech 18.5%. Record-high total contract value (TCV) of deal wins has also been observed.

title: Operation Ajay: SpiceJet A340 develops snag in Tel Aviv
description: A wide body Airbus A340 that was to bring back Indians from Israel on Sunday developed a snag on landing in Tel Aviv. The aircraft, wet leased by SpiceJet (leased along with operating crew), had flown from Delhi to Tel Aviv with no passenger to bring back people from there.

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) expands party executive in organizational restructuring
description: Six new leaders have been appointed, including Members of Parliament Vinayak Raut, Anil Desai, Rajan Vichare, Members of the Legislative Assembly Ravindra Waikar, Sunil Prabhu, and Member of the Legislative Council Anil Prabhu.

title: Hamas fighters were given 'warrior's guide' for Israel attack
description: Israel President Isaac Herzog showcased a booklet titled "The Warrior's Guide: Jihadi Version", claiming it was found on a Hamas terrorist's body. The booklet provides detailed instructions on kidnapping tactics, including torture and using hostages as human shields. It also advises terrorists on capturing territory using suicide bombings, car bombings, ambushes, and sniper attacks. The manual includes information on the Israel Defense Force's structure and armaments.

title: Delhi businessman booked for molesting Russian woman in Goa
description: The incident occurred on October 12 when the accused and the victim convened in a resort room to discuss a business proposition, as stated by Inspector Paresh Naik of the Calangute police station.

title: Nithari killings: Allahabad HC says investigation botched up
description: The Allahabad High Court expressed disappointment in the investigation of the Nithari case, stating that basic norms of evidence collection were violated. The court criticized the failure to probe the possibility of organ trade being the cause of the killings, despite recommendations from the Ministry of Women and Child Development. The court also accused the investigation of targeting a poor servant without properly exploring the involvement of organized activity in organ trading.

title: Actor accuses househelp of stealing jewellery, cash in Mumbai
description: Yamini Rawal, 40, has said in her complaint that the accused, Pramod Gupta, 20, was working at her residence for the past two months. At times, he would also work at her mother's home in Andheri. He lived at her home as did a cook, Shubham Gupta, who had been employed for the past three years. Pramod's parents stayed at Grant Road and he would visit them sometimes.

title: JD(S) leader revolts against Deve Gowda's alliance decision
description: C M Ibrahim, senior leader of the Janata Dal (Secular) in Karnataka, has opposed party's decision to ally with the BJP for the upcoming Lok Sabha elections. He claimed that his faction is the original JD(S) and that he, as the state president, can make decisions for the party in Karnataka. Ibrahim stated that the JD(S) will not ally with the NDA and will form a core committee to convey this decision to party leader Deve Gowda.

title: How Kohli is instrumental in cricket's inclusion in LA Olympics
description: With an impressive record of over 25,000 international runs, 77 tons, and numerous memorable moments in his roles as a captain, cricketer, and a prominent figure in society, Virat Kohli has earned a place in the hearts of sporting enthusiasts across the globe.

title: Mhadei wildlife sanctuary to be notified as 55th tiger reserve of India
description: The Mhadei wildlife sanctuary in Goa will be officially designated as a tiger reserve, becoming the 55th tiger reserve in India. The Goa government had sought to overturn a court order requiring the declaration of the sanctuary as a tiger reserve, but the Supreme Court has refused to stay the order. The proposal to establish the tiger reserve dates back to 2011, and the Goa government is now obligated to notify it by October 24th, 2023.

title: Canada says no sign India tensions are impacting military ties
description: The diplomatic standoff between India and Canada over the killing of a Sikh separatist leader has not affected military cooperation between the two nations, according to a top Canadian navy official. Commodore David Mazur stated that there have been "friendly meetings" with Indian officials and that there has been no impact on defense diplomacy and security.

title: BJP says it has nothing to do with reception hosted for Pakistani players
description: Reacting to Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray's criticism on Sunday that if the BJP can shower flowers on the Pakistan players then why cannot the Sena join hands with the socialist parties. Shelar on Monday said the reception was hosted by the International Cricket Council.

title: Exclusive: Ankita Lokhande expresses feelings on doing BB 17
description: Ankita Lokhande, known for her role in Pavitra Rishta, will be entering Bigg Boss 17 with her husband Vicky Jain. In an interview, Ankita revealed that her husband convinced her to do the show and she sees it as a work project. She also addressed people's judgments of her, stating that she only speaks honestly and does not intend to hurt anyone. Ankita hopes that viewers will understand her true nature through the show. She also mentioned that her fashion game will reflect her lifestyle.

title: 'Just one in 8 attempts': Sehwag trolls Vaughan
description: Defending champions England’s ODI World Cup campaign got off to a disastrous start losing two games out of three. And Afghanistan piled on more misery by handing them a shocking 69-run defeat at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi on Sunday. But England's tumultuous start does not seem to deter former skipper Michael Vaughan's hopes of seeing his team into the last four of the tournament.

title: Iron Beam: Is Israel field testing a new laser-based weapon?
description: Videos have surfaced online allegedly showing Israel testing its new laser-based missile defense system, known as Iron Beam. The system, developed by Israeli defense contractor Rafael Advanced Defense Systems, uses a directed-energy weapon to destroy airborne targets. It offers lower costs per shot, unlimited firings, and lower operational costs compared to conventional missile interceptors. Iron Beam is designed to destroy short-range rockets within seconds.

title: Some working overtime to harm our name, says Adani Group
description: The Adani Group has accused certain groups and individuals of working to harm the company's reputation and market standing. This comes after a complaint was filed by Supreme Court lawyer Jai Anant Dehadrai against Trinamool MP Mahua Moitra and CEO of Hiranandani Group, Darshan Hiranandani. The complaint alleges a criminal conspiracy to target Gautam Adani and his group of companies.

title: PM Modi to inaugurate India's first RAPIDX project on Oct 20
description: Delhi-Meerut RRTS inauguration: A priority section of RAPIDX, which is India’s first Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS), is all set to be inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi on October 20.

title: 'This marks the dawn of a new era': Sachin on cricket's inclusion in LA28
description: Alongside cricket, which will be contested in the T20 format, the International Olympic Committee (IOC), during its 141st session, also sanctioned the inclusion of other sports such as squash, baseball/softball, lacrosse, and flag football.

title: Let's see what experts recommend for healthy heart
description: World Heart Day (WHD) is celebrated all across the world on 29th September to create mass awareness about the essentials of cardiac care and promote heart-healthy habits.

title: India doesn't want its state refiners to pay for Russian oil in Chinese yuan?
description: India has become the leading importer of Russian seaborne oil this year, taking advantage of discounted prices following the suspension of Russian oil imports by some nations.

title: Gambhir makes another big statement on 2011 WC final
description: Gautam Gambhir is known for not mincing his words and the former India opener once again hogged the limelight for his big statement on the 2011 World Cup final between India and Sri Lanka. MS Dhoni was adjudged player of the match for his match-winning unbeaten 91-run knock that helped chase down 275-run target to lift the World Cup trophy but Gambhir thought the award should have been given to another player.

title: Cameras in Delhi to detect vehicles without valid PUC
description: Currently, the department is only able to send a notice to violators via SMS, work is underway to generate e-challans and get them sent directly to owners who don’t have valid PUC. With the onset of the dreaded smog season in Delhi, technologies like this could play an important role in keeping pollution levels under check and violations at bay.

title: Niobobaotite: China finds never-before-seen ore
Why 'neutral' China is picking a side in the Israel-Hamas conflict
description: Chinese envoy Zhai Jun is set to visit the Middle East to advocate for a ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas conflict. The visit aims to coordinate with various parties to secure a ceasefire, protect civilians, alleviate the situation, and promote dialogue. China's pro-Palestinian stance is driven by its desire to enhance its image and influence in the Arab and Muslim world, challenge the US role in the region, and contrast its own constructive role with the US's failure to bring peace and stability.

title: Gaganyaan mission: Here’s what Isro will attempt on October 21
description: The Isro is preparing for the first test vehicle abort mission as part of the Gaganyaan program. The mission will simulate an abort condition during ascent, with the crew module and crew escape systems being separated from the test vehicle at an altitude of about 17km. The crew module will be recovered in the Bay of Bengal using a dedicated vessel and diving team from the Indian Navy.

title: Malayalam actor Rahman to play martial arts guru in Tiger Shroff's 'Ganapath'
description: Malayalam actor Rahman is set to make his Bollywood debut as the antagonist in the film 'Ganapath' starring Tiger Shroff. Rahman's character is rumored to be the son of Amitabh Bachchan's character, adding to the excitement. Directed by Vikas Bahl, 'Ganapath' is a science fiction dystopian action film that follows the story of a vigilante named Ganapath, played by Tiger Shroff. The film also stars Kriti Sanon and Amitabh Bachchan in pivotal roles. 'Ganapath' is scheduled to release on October 20.

title: Wasim Akram's big revelation: 'There is no fitness test' for Pakistan players
description: Former Pakistan pacer Wasim Akram came down hard on Babar Azam's men after they suffered an embarrassing seven-wicket defeat at the hands of India in their ICC ODI World Cup match at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad on Saturday. Akram, who was known as the 'Sultan of Swing' during his playing days, also highlighted poor fitness as the reason behind Pakistan's lacklustre show against the Rohit Sharma-led side.

title: Israel military releases satellite images showing Hamas' war crimes
description: The Israel Defence Forces (IDF) have shared satellite images showing the destruction caused by Hamas attacks. Israel is evacuating residents near the Lebanese border and is preparing for a ground invasion. A border crossing into Gaza is expected to reopen for aid efforts. The death toll in Gaza has risen to at least 2,670, with 9,600 people injured.

title: Tesla EV beats 100+ bullets, Toyota truck chase by Hamas terrorists
description: Amid the ongoing conflict between Hamas and Israel, a story was shared on social media about an Israeli man who escaped armed terrorists in his Tesla Model 3 Performance.

title: Nithari killings: HC acquits Surinder Koli, Pandher, death penalty cancelled
Magnitude 4 earthquake hits near Uttarakhand
description: An earthquake of magnitude 4.0 on the Richter scale struck near Pithoragarh district in Uttarakhand on Monday, the National Centre for Seismology (NCS) said.

title: Apple’s India map provider doubles as it rivals Google’s product
description: Shares of MapmyIndia, an Indian navigation company, have doubled in value in the past six months as its mapping service gains popularity in India. Market analysts are divided on whether the rally will continue, with some seeing the company's domestic growth potential while others consider its valuation to be a barrier. The company, founded by Rakesh and Rashmi Verma, provides mapping services to businesses such as Apple and BMW. MapmyIndia is also investing in drone technologies and expanding internationally to meet client demand.

title: Why Xi's $1 trillion ‘project of the century’ faces uncertain future
description: The future of China's Belt and Road initiative (BRI) looks uncertain as momentum has tapered off in recent years. China's overall activity in BRI countries is down about 40% from its 2018 peak, and Beijing faces accusations of being an irresponsible lender. The Covid-19 pandemic has further slowed down the initiative, and geopolitical tensions and domestic economic problems in China continue to pose challenges.

title: 'India's first semiconductor plant expected in one year'
description: "We are focussing on some niche area where we can take global leadership. Telecom and EV (electric vehicles) have emerged as a big segment for semiconductors. If we focus on developing and manufacturing chips used in these segments then we can become global leaders in these two segments," Vaishnaw told PTI in an interview.

title: 'India ne Pakistan ko bacchon ki tarah mara': Shoaib Akhtar
description: Former fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar continues to slam Pakistan for producing an insipid performance against India in the ODI World Cup on Saturday and went on to admit that India 'beat' Pakistan like kids.

title: A poor tribal district of Odisha turns into a coffee hub
description: Koraput's tribal community in India has found a new source of income and livelihood through coffee farming. The efforts of an official named Ajit Rout have led to significant growth in the coffee industry in the Koraput district. This year, a coffee brand called Kruti Coffee's "Kindiriguda Naturals" won India's best "natural coffee" award. The success of the coffee industry has transformed the lives of many tribals, providing them with steady incomes. The aim now is to make Odisha a major coffee hub in India.

title: Demographic shift in Punjab? Dip in population growth rate
description: Punjab's population growth rate has been declining over the past decade, with the annual addition to the population falling by 50% from 2011 to 2020. The state's population growth rate of 1.65% is lower than the national average of 2.98%. The decline in population growth is attributed to young Punjabis emigrating abroad and settling there, while migrants from other states in Punjab are contributing to the birth rate. This trend may have a significant impact on the Sikh population, which has already been declining nationally. There is also a visible trend of Muslim migration to Punjab due to its communal stability.

title: World Cup: How Siraj bounced back to trigger Pakistan's collapse
description: Indian pacer Siraj was responding to a query on how he bounced back after his first two overs in the match against Pakistan went for 20 runs. He stormed back to remove Abdullah Shafique first and Pakistan skipper Babar Azam later — both to cross-seam deliveries -- to trigger Pakistan's collapse. From 155/2 the visitors slipped to 191 all out. India, led by Rohit Sharma's blitz, went on to win by 7 wickets with more than 19 overs to spare.

title: Israeli tourists in Jaisalmer are leaving to fight against Hamas
Bengal’s women live a life, says Mahua after brutal trolling
description: Trinamool MP Mahua Moitra responded to trolling and abuse on social media after photos of her with Congress MP Shashi Tharoor at a dinner party surfaced. She stated that Bengal's women live their lives truthfully and criticized the BJP for attacking women in such a manner. Sociologist Prasanta Ray supported Moitra's defense, stating that women should have the right to drink without prejudice. Filmmaker Madhuja Mukherjee highlighted the gendered nature of trolling and the threats that women often face.

title: Heart moved 14km in 13 mins to save girl’s life in B'luru
Sharad Pawar letter on Chhagan Bhujbal’s health in 2018 emerges
Rs 1 crore lost to cyber frauds daily in Haryana, only Rs 10 lakh recovered: Police
description: The cyber police chief of Haryana, OP Singh, has expressed concern over the low recovery and blocking rate of online fraud cases in the state. He stated that people in Haryana are cheated of around Rs 1 crore daily, but only Rs 10 lakh is recovered or blocked. Singh suggested measures such as using artificial intelligence and machine learning to detect frauds in real-time, training programs for nodal officers, and establishing a 24x7 communication channel with the police's cybercrime unit to improve the response to cyber threats and crimes.

title: 'Muslims must die': 6-year-old boy killed in US in hate crime
description: A 71-year-old man from Illinois has been charged with a hate crime for fatally stabbing a 6-year-old boy and injuring a 32-year-old woman. Police say the victims were targeted because of their Islamic faith and as a response to the conflict between Israel and Hamas. The woman called 911 and fought off the attacker, who was found with injuries to his forehead. The suspect has been charged with murder, attempted murder, hate crimes, and aggravated battery.

title: 'Both loved same girl': 18-yr-old stabs friend to death
description: In Ahmedabad, a 22-year-old man was stabbed to death by his 18-year-old friend due to a love triangle involving the same girl. The suspect, Vedant Raja, drove the victim's body to the police station in his car and confessed to the crime. The victim, Swapnil Prajapati, had multiple stab wounds and was found dead in the car. The police are still investigating the case and are yet to question the girl and their mutual friends who may have more information about the dispute.

title: Assam: 12 students return from Israel, recount horrors
description: Under Operation Ajay, Indian students and researchers who were stranded in Israel due to the Israel-Hamas conflict are being evacuated and brought back to Assam. Those who have returned shared their experiences of being caught off-guard by the conflict and having to take shelter in bunkers. They described the fear of both rocket attacks and possible ground assaults. Despite their relief at being able to return home, some expressed sadness at having to cut short their research dreams in Israel. Many caregivers from India, including those from Northeastern states, are still in Israel, providing services to elderly people.

title: Nafisa is Kumari for Kolkata's all-women Durga Puja this Navami
description: A community Durga Puja in New Town, Kolkata, has decided to worship a Muslim girl, Nafisa, as Goddess Durga during Kumari Puja on Navami to promote communal harmony. The all-women committee of Mrittika Club chose Nafisa for their first-ever puja. This decision is inspired by Swami Vivekananda's worship of a Muslim girl as Goddess Durga in 1898. The organisers aim to spread the message of unity and brotherhood, breaking societal divisions. This initiative follows a similar event earlier this year when a Muslim girl was worshipped as 'kumari' during Khuti Puja in north Kolkata.

title: West Bengal scholar ‘murdered’ in Sweden
description: A research guide from Durgapur, India, working at a university in Sweden, was found dead in her apartment near the university campus. Her family suspects murder, and a person has been arrested in connection with the case. The last time she contacted her family was on September 29, and her phone was switched off the next day. Her body was found on October 13, and her family is requesting assistance from the Indian and Swedish governments to bring her body back and bring the perpetrators to justice.

title: TCS on track to hire 40,000 freshers in FY2024: COO
description: TCS COO N Ganapathy Subramaniam has stated that the company plans to hire 40,000 campus recruits in the current financial year. The company is focused on improving its own utilization and has a decent bench to meet demand. Meanwhile, Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy has indicated that they will not be going to campuses until demand picks up. TCS is also considering adding laterals to its talent pool based on the outlook for discretionary spending. The company currently has 60,000 employees on the bench who can be productively deployed.

title: Asked to wait in queue, man stabs golgappa seller in Noida
description: A 30-year-old golgappa seller in Noida was stabbed in the abdomen by a customer who became angry when asked to wait in line. The incident occurred at the seller's stall in Sector 49, where a crowd had gathered. The attacker, identified as Vikas Sharma, fled the scene while the victim, Ravindra Kumar, was rushed to the hospital and is now stable. An FIR has been registered against the attacker, and the police are currently searching for him.

title: Deaths mount on one of India's longest highways
description: Twelve people, including a six-year-old girl, were killed and 23 others injured in a collision between a mini-bus and a stationary truck on the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi expressway in India. This is the second major accident on the expressway in three months. The victims were returning from a religious visit when the accident occurred. The mini-bus driver claimed he did not see the truck until it was too late. Two officers from the Regional Transport Office (RTO) have been booked in connection with the accident. Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his condolences and announced financial aid for the victims' families.

title: ‘Jai Shri Ram’ chants at Pak cricketers a new low: Udhayanidhi
description: Indian sports minister Udhayanidhi Stalin has criticized cricket fans for heckling Pakistani cricketers during a match in Ahmedabad by chanting 'Jai Shree Ram'. He called it a "new low" in Indian cricket history and stated that sports should not be used to spread hatred. The incident received widespread condemnation, although Tamil Nadu BJP leaders defended the heckling, claiming that the words 'Jai Shree Ram' are deeply rooted in Indian culture. The BJP leaders also argued that Indian cricketers have faced worse treatment in Pakistan.

title: Gzb: Condo lift with mother, son (3) has free fall from 8th floor
description: A woman and her three-year-old son had a terrifying experience when the lift they were in fell from the eighth floor to the basement in a residential building in Ghaziabad. The woman tried to open the door but was unsuccessful, and the alarms were not working. Eventually, the lift moved up on its own and stopped on the ground floor, allowing them to exit safely. The incident has raised concerns about the maintenance and safety of the lifts in the building.

title: 'No immediate war impact on economy': Chief economic adviser
description: V Anantha Nageswaran, the Chief Economic Adviser of India, believes that the war in West Asia will not have an immediate economic impact. However, he suggests monitoring the situation closely. Nageswaran is optimistic about the Indian economy, stating that private investment is already happening and demand is strong.
